a-size-base: Great at getting our big baby to focus
a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2021
a-size-base 3: We have a 8 month old retriever who were training to be a hunting dog. Most of our program has trained with hot dogs, however carrying a pocket of hotdogs around isn't always feasible. So we've been looking for some treats that will get him to focus when we're out so we can reinforce the basics.For a food driven puppy he's very particular about treats (probably because he gets hot dogs all the time!) But as soon as I opened the bag, he was engaged. These are a soft chew and don't give off a lot of mess on your hands or your pocket and they're small enough that they are a good reward without taking too long for them to chomp down before the next repetition.I think for the price and the quality these are a great treat to keep your little ones focused on the task at hand an learning.
a-size-base 4: Great at getting our big baby to focus

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on November 19, 2022
a-size-base 3: love this brand and the quality.

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on October 19, 2022
a-size-base 3: Our Lab loves them and has had no side effects

a-size-base: Little treats often ideal for our small dog, who is gaining weight
a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on October 12, 2021
a-size-base 3: We don’t have a puppy, but these little chicken treats are ideal for our small, spoiled dog, who has put on weight over the years and doesn’t always need to have a larger, more extravagent type of treat. I think she likes the chicken flavor of these treats, and I like how they contain probiotics and colostrum for gut health and improved immunity.The list of ingredients in these treats is mercifully short, indicating there isn’t a lot of processed junk. Though I wouldn’t say these treats are Sally’s favorite of all time, she does like getting them, and again, I like their small size and minimal calories. I can definitely see how these treats would be good for training puppies. They seem moist and are not too soft, not too hard.These treats do not contain corn, soy, or wheat.

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2021
a-size-base 3: Our puppy loves the flavor. We also like that they are small but if you're doing a lot of training consecutively, you can actually break them in half so you're not filling your dog up with treats.

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on June 5, 2022
a-size-base 3: My puppy loves this treat.

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on September 10, 2022
a-size-base 3: My original package came from the breeder when we picked up our new puppy and was very most, easy to break into smaller pieces. So, I purchased three packages from here. I have now opened my second package only to find that, unlike my first package, these packages are very dry and crumbly. The expiration date shows 10/29/23, so I would not expect such a contrast in quality. Unfortunately, I do not know what the date was on the original package, So I guess in the future I will purchase from the local pet store so that I can check the date before purchase.

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on June 7, 2021
a-size-base 3: Our new puppy loves these treats. As he is getting older he is chewing them up faster.

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on November 17, 2021
a-size-base 3: I have a very picky small princess dog, so yours might like these. I recommend the puppy teething sticks by this company instead. She loves them and they really are a "treat" to her. I would have no luck training with these little bites

a-size-base: This bag was a bad batch of treats. They were stale
a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on August 13, 2022
a-size-base 3: This particular bag of treat was spoiled and does rate a one star.  Fortunately, my dog would not take the treat. I have bought this same product several times before.  And my dog loved it.  I will return the bad bag of N-BONE puppy training treats. I do not want a refund.

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2021
a-size-base 3: My pups love these treats... they are always waiting for me when they see me reach into my pocket or the treat bag.As training treats, I think they could be a bit smaller... and in more quantities... the texture could could a bit softer because I do break them apart.I have a 1 year old and a 3 year old dog and they both seem to enjoy them.

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on September 22, 2021
a-size-base 3: These smell good! Aussie puppy seems veeeeeeery interested when we are practicing commands. Size is good for pups but also for up to medium sized grown dogs.Recommended!P.S. If this review was good for you at all, please do hit the "helpful" button so I know that I'm not wasting my time posting this! Thanks in advance :)
a-size-base 5: These smell good! Aussie puppy seems veeeeeeery interested when we are practicing commands. Size is good for pups but also for up to medium sized grown dogs.Recommended!P.S. If this review was good for you at all, please do hit the "helpful" button so I know that I'm not wasting my time posting this! Thanks in advance :)

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2021
a-size-base 3: I always watch out the ingredients of dog food and treats. The ingredient list seems good and natural. My 15 lb mini-schnauzer loves it. Just careful, they tend to crumble.

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on September 17, 2021
a-size-base 3: We bought these, our dalmatian loves it.  We train him with this, he is still in training so we have bought a lot of these.  They are just the perfect size.  It helps so much in training.

a-size-base: Good puppy-  treat, especially for training
a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2022
a-size-base 3: The first package I received were hard so Amazon took care of it right away and sent a fresh package. My puppy loves these soft treats! They work great for potty training and for every day treats. They’re just the right size for puppies! I definitely recommend them

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on October 3, 2021
a-size-base 3: Rosie finishes each chew stick.  Other sticks get left aside, unfinished.

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on March 17, 2022
a-size-base 3: I was looking for a treat that had less calories than our last ones. This one is exactly what I needed and my chihuahua absolutely loves them.

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on October 9, 2021
a-size-base 3: I wish the bags were bigger

a-size-base 2: Reviewed in the United States on November 29, 2022
a-size-base 3: These training treats work great! Even when in the middle of mischief they will stop and sit immediately for one of these.
